document.discussion_title: Man wanted in 2015 Chapel Hill bank robbery turns self in | WNCN
document.topic_text: Man wanted in 2015 Chapel Hill bank robbery turns self in By CBS North Carolina Staff Published: April 25, 2016, 2:55 pm Police searching for Chapel Hill bank robbery suspect CHAPEL HILL, N.C. (CBS North Carolina) – A man wanted for robbing a SunTrust Bank in Chapel Hill on May 28, 2015 turned himself in on April 21, Chapel Hill Police said. Gregory Bauer Roberts, 46, of Chapel Hill, turned himself in at Orange County Jail and was charged with one felony count of common law robbery. Roberts robbed the bank, located on Dobbin Drive, around 10:45 a.m., police said. Roberts was able to leave the bank with an undisclosed amount of cash. He did not display a weapon during the robbery. Roberts has been processed at Orange County Jail and he was released on $10,000 unsecured bond. Share this:
